commits.message: Use board sizing in tetris_game.h through code

pull_request.title: Use board sizing in tetris_game.h through code
pull_request.body:
This PR addresses issue #4 

## Changelog

This PR updates all code to respect the board size specified in `tetris_game.h` at build time. The `ncurses` rendering code and the networking message serialization had to be updated.

## Testing

Testing of the server, single-player ncurses client, and multi-player ncurses client were conducted manually. I successfully tested the default board size, as well as a 34x20 board.

## Usage

To change the board size when compiling, you should edit the lines defining `BOARD_WIDTH`, `BOARD_HEIGHT`, `BOARD_PLAY_HEIGHT`, and `BLOCK_START_POSITION` in `tetris_game.h`.

## Future Work

- Allow board size to be specified at runtime
- Document functionality

This PR addresses issue #4

## Testing

Testing of the server, single-player ncurses client, and multi-player ncurses client were conducted manually. I successfully tested the default board size, as well as a 34x20 board.

## Usage

To change the board size when compiling, you should edit the lines defining `BOARD_WIDTH`, `BOARD_HEIGHT`, `BOARD_PLAY_HEIGHT`, and `BLOCK_START_POSITION` in `tetris_game.h`.

## Future Work

- Document functionality

issue.title: Display Score
issue.body: The score is already calculated, and was demoed by @Nitepone during [Big Red Hacks](https://www.bigredhacks.com/). This score needs to be integrated into the `ncurses` client.

issue.title: Stop Games when Players Leave
issue.body:
Currently, games will continue long after a player has disconnected. The server needs to handle removing clients that have disconnected, and stopping the game threads for those clients.

This needs to be done safely, such that any of the multiple threads accessing a player's data are not impacted.

issue.title: Single Player NCurses
issue.body: As a user, I want to be able to play offline (but still using ncurses) by passing a command line flag.

issue.title: Single Player NCurses
issue.body: As a user, I want to be able to play offline (but still using ncurses) by passing a command line flag.

comment.body: This feature is complete as of commit `5567e94a10`. Run the client with `./client -s` to use single-player mode. Multi-player still works the same as before.
